longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and/or passport replacing documents must be valid
  for the period of intended stay. 

Visa required, except for Nationals of Belarus holding
passports endorsed "business".
Visa required, except for Nationals of Belarus traveling as a
tourist, either individually with "vouchers" or in a travel
group organized by a travel agency. 
Visa required, except for A max. stay of 90 days for nationals
of Belarus holding an authorisation of invitation when
visiting relatives or friends or authorised telegram in
emergencies, ceremonies and illness.
Visa required, except for Nationals of Belarus visiting the
grave of a relative, which can be proven by a Red Cross
certificate; or traveling for medical reasons, provided
holding referral or invitation from health organisation. 
Visa required, except for A max. stay of 15 days, totaling 90
days within a six month period, for holders of a "C" visa
issued by a Schengen Member State. 
 - Visa must be valid for at least 5 days beyond the period of
   intended stay in Macedonia (FYROM) and must be valid to
   (re-)enter the Schengen Area . It must also be
   valid for all Schengen Member States. Entry into Macedonia
   (FYROM) does not affect the validity of the visa. Used
   single entry Schengen visas are not included.
- Information on Schengen visas  
Minors:
- Unaccompanied passengers under 18 years of age
   
- Minors born abroad to nationals of Macedonia (FYROM) and not
  holding a passport, must 
Additional Information:
- A valid visa in an expired passport
   
Warning:
- Visitors not holding return/onward tickets could be refused
  entry
shortInfo: При наличии свидетельства о приглашении или телеграммы, либо туристического документа
